item.title: Manila lifts truck ban
item.description: After almost seven months of standing pat on imposing a truck ban in the country's capital city, Manila Mayor Joseph Estrada finally relented on Saturday (September 13) and lifted the controversial ordinance.

item.title: PH starts inquiry into Filipino militants in Syria
item.description: The Philippines is investigating the involvement of Filipino Islamists in the three-year civil war in Syria after two locals were reported killed fighting for Islamic State militant group, an intelligence official said on Saturday (September 13).

item.title: Signal #2 up in Cagayan, Isabela
item.description: Tropical Storm "Luis" intensified further as it continued to move towards the Cagayan-Isabela area, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said on Saturday afternoon (September 13). Public Storm Warning Signal No. 2 has been raised in Isabela and Cagayan provinces late afternoon.

item.title: Chinese trader kidnapped in Zambo Sibugay
item.description: Military and police forces are in pursuit of six unidentified armed men who kidnapped a Chinese businessman in Kabalasan, Zamboanga Sibugay on Thursday (September 11).

item.title: PH displays ancient maps to debunk China's sea claims
item.description: The Philippines on Thursday put on display dozens of ancient maps which officials said showed that China's territorial claims over the South China Sea did not include a disputed shoal at the center of an acrimonious standoff.

item.title: US Congress awards special medals for 911 dead
item.description: (UPDATE 2) Members of Congress gathered in the US Capitol on Wednesday (September 10) together with relatives of those who died in the 9/11 attacks to pay tribute to their heroism. The legislators presented three special medals awarded by the US Congress to three groups of these heroes.

item.title: PH to deport Islamic teacher over terror links
item.description: The Philippines plans to deport a Canadian national this week after he was reported to be "inciting and recruiting locals to conduct terrorist activities", the Bureau of Immigration (BI) said on Wednesday (September 10).

item.title: Potential cyclone spotted, may enter PH on Friday
item.description: A potential cyclone tracking the country’s path is being monitored by the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA).

item.title: Another cop in gun-pointing incident surrenders
item.description: (Update 1) Senior Inspector Allan Emlano, a suspect in the gun-pointing incident on EDSA last week, surrendered to the Quezon City Police District (QCPD) on Wednesday morning (September 10) and, as part of the booking process, was taken to the East Avenue Medical Center for a medical examination.

item.title: Househelper claims Dalia, Sandy intimacy
item.description: (Update 1) A housemaid of slain car racer Enzo Pastor claimed that she witnessed the victim's widow and the alleged brains behind the killing having sexual intercourse inside the house whenever the international race champ was out of the country.
